page.title: 05Stockingford Allotments
page.content: To local people it is known as the {'Cabbage'.}It began in a very small way as a dig for victory effort during the{First World War.}Today it is the town's biggest self contained community enterprise with assets approaching Â£160,000. The Kaiser with his U-boats was trying to starve Britain into submission when a group of Stockingford railwaymen and miners obtained a piece of land and formed{Stockingford Allotments {Association}to grow food for their families. They were to become landlords of nearly 80 acres including a farm which would have a sports field and two magnificent licensed clubs which became the hub of social and recreational activities in Stockingford.When first formed these allotments were on the site of{Cross {St.}and{St. Paul's Rd.
